question: Tsai Ing-wen was recently re-elected as the President of which country?
explanation:
In the recently held presidential election of Taiwan, Tsai Ing-wen was re-elected as the countryâ€™s President. With more than 57% of the votes, Tsai won her second presidential term. Her victory in the election has gained significance as she vowed to protect the sovereignty of Taiwan amidst of the threats posed by China.
China has announced that Taiwan must be united with China at any cost and it would use power if necessary. There were several protests across the country against China\'s Authoritarian behaviour.
